clinical_study.brief_title: Gas Exchange Kinetics and Work Load During Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: Gas Exchange Kinetics and Work Load During Different Exercise Protocols in Healthy Children and Young Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to understand how different kinds of exercise affect the human body and the health of the heart and lungs. For example, some people like to exercise continuously for relatively long periods of time while others like to exercise for short periods of time with rest periods in between. Children tend to exercise in frequent bouts of brief exercise interspersed with periods of rest. Also, some people like running or treadmill exercise while others like to work out on stationary bicycles. To date, standard exercise testing is based on a century-old paradigm used predominantly for adults that involves maximal exercise protocols (cardiopulmonary exercise testing-CPET). Moreover, different but widely used exercise modalities such as cycle ergometer and treadmills are currently impossible to compare in children, and this has limited the clinical and research application of such testing in the pediatric age-range. A major premise of this laboratory is that laboratory testing of cardiopulmonary fitness in children should be based on protocols that mimic naturally occurring patterns of exercise in children, rather than those that have been artificially employed to assess maximal efforts in adults. This research project designed to begin the process of systematically identifying protocols can be best used for children and young adults. Participants will exercise in different protocols on a bicycle ergometer or treadmill. This research could lead to improved and more accurate fitness assessment and pave the way to an improved personalized exercise program in health and illness.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Oxygen Uptake (VO2) measurements during exercise
primary_outcome.description: Breath by breath gas exchange VO2 in response to exercise.

primary_outcome.measure: Carbon Dioxide Production (VCO2) measurements during exercise
primary_outcome.description: Breath by breath gas exchange VCO2 in response to exercise
Breath by breath gas exchange Minute ventilation (VE) in response to exercise
Breath by breath gas exchange HR values in response to exercise

secondary_outcome.description: Physical activity questionnaire - Points are given to each level of activity, the mean of these points are taken which will give a physical activity summary score

Godin Leisure Time Exercise questionnaire - Total score will be measured Godin Leisure Time Exercise questionnaire - Total leisure activity score is calculated from points given to each level of activity from light to strenuous

secondary_outcome.measure: Lean body mass measurements by Dial X-Ray Absorbiometry (DXA)
Fat percentage measurements by Dial X-Ray Absorbiometry (DXA)
Fat free mass measurements by Dial X-Ray Absorbiometry (DXA)
Bone mass measurements by Dial X-Ray Absorbiometry (DXA)

secondary_outcome.description: Muscle mass in kg's will be determined by ultrasound

secondary_outcome.measure: Puberty status measurements by using a growth and development questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Children will fill a standard Tanner Staging questionnaire. The Tanner staging defines the physical characteristics of individuals. A Tanner stage status assigned to each child depending on their primary and secondary sexual development characteristics.
Concentration of oxy- and de-oxyhemoglobin will be measured non-invasively
Respiratory sensors will be used to evaluate breath rate
Spirometry will be used to evaluate lung volume

arm_group.arm_group_label: Treadmill Exercise in Adolescents and Adults
arm_group.description: Comparison of gas exchange kinetics between treadmill and cyclo ergometer exercises

arm_group.arm_group_label: Cyclo Ergometer Exercise in Adolescents and Adults
arm_group.description: Comparison of gas exchange kinetics between treadmill and cyclo ergometer exercises

intervention.description: Comparison of stationary bike and treadmill exercise among adolescents and adults
intervention.arm_group_label: Cyclo Ergometer Exercise in Adolescents and Adults
Treadmill Exercise in Adolescents and Adults

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Between the ages of 7-35 years old without any known respiratory, cardiac or metabolic disease
- Determined to be in good health by preparticipation history
- No evidence of disease or disability that would impair participation in an exercise testing
- No chronic prescribed medication
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other limitation which in the eyes of the physician that would preclude ability to perform exercise testing
- Use of illegal drugs or abuse of alcohol
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding

facility.name: Pediatric Exercise and Genomics Research Center, University of California, Irvine
